posts.name: Eric1
posts.cooked:
Hey, I am attempting to use the advanced swerve template from the advantage kit examples and have teleop working great, however I am having autonomous drivetrain issues.

My desired path

When I make the wheels not touch the ground it looks like it’s doing the right thing.

When I put the robot on the ground it goes absolutely crazy. (Odometry in AS looks the same as in real life)

I am having struggles finding out what the issue is.

I think it’s slightly weird that when I first downloaded the code I had to revert the right joystick’s x value to make the robot rotate right when you tap right on that joystick. IDK though. The gyroscope is CCP.

Code: GitHub - frc6548/2024-Crescendo-Code

It looks like you aren’t configuring your autobuilder in your code, that seems like it could be the issue

edit: although if thats the case i’m confused how the robot is moving at all then? You should have something like this:

posts.name: Eric1
posts.cooked: In Drive.java (line 87) there is an autobuilder

Based on the behavior, I would guess the PID for path following was way overtuned, but I’m not sure what the default values are for HolonomicPathFollowerConfig are. You could try feeding values into it (unless I missed it in your code somewhere).

posts.name: Eric1
posts.cooked:
Hey, that definitely helped, however there is still something wrong.

The rotation is completely off (hard to see in the video) I am not sure if it is PID or what.

The real PID is in module.java which when changed changes the teleop and auto driving. The AutoBuilder PID is in drive.java, which I don’t know what to change it to.

New Code: 2024-Crescendo-Code-laptop2/src/main/java/frc/robot at main · frc6548/2024-Crescendo-Code-laptop2 · GitHub
.1 seems low. Our team uses 5.0 P for both PIDs.

posts.name: Eric1
posts.cooked: I tried that too and the issues persisted it’s like the gyroscope readings are wrong…
